title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: import_hgnc_dataset() reads data directly memory. Use download_hgnc_dataset() save data disk first, import straightaway disk:
code: # Note that `download_hgnc_dataset()` returns the path of the saved file. (local_file <- download_hgnc_dataset()) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/hgnc/hgnc/vignettes/articles/hgnc_complete_set.tsv" import_hgnc_dataset(file = local_file) #> # A tibble: 44,117 × 55 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name     locus_group locus_type status location #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>    <chr>       <chr>      <chr>  <chr>    #>  1 HGNC:5            5 A1BG      alpha-1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  2 HGNC:37133    37133 A1BG-AS1  A1BG an… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  3 HGNC:24086    24086 A1CF      APOBEC1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 10q11.23 #>  4 HGNC:7            7 A2M       alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  5 HGNC:27057    27057 A2M-AS1   A2M ant… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  6 HGNC:23336    23336 A2ML1     alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  7 HGNC:41022    41022 A2ML1-AS1 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  8 HGNC:41523    41523 A2ML1-AS2 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  9 HGNC:8            8 A2MP1     alpha-2… pseudogene  pseudogene Appro… 12p13.31 #> 10 HGNC:30005    30005 A3GALT2   alpha 1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 1p35.1   #> # ℹ 44,107 more rows #> # ℹ 47 more variables: location_sortable <chr>, alias_symbol <list>, #> #   alias_name <list>, prev_symbol <list>, prev_name <list>, gene_group <list>, #> #   gene_group_id <list>, date_approved_reserved <date>, #> #   date_symbol_changed <date>, date_name_changed <date>, date_modified <date>, #> #   entrez_id <chr>, ensembl_gene_id <chr>, vega_id <chr>, ucsc_id <chr>, #> #   ena <list>, refseq_accession <list>, ccds_id <list>, uniprot_ids <list>, …

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: HGNC complete gene data sets released monthly quarterly. prefer download specific release latest, use first function list_archives() list available archives: pass URL corresponding archive interest import_hgnc_dataset():
code: (releases <- list_archives("monthly")) #> # A tibble: 135 × 9 #>    series  dataset     archive file  date       size  last_modified       md5sum #>    <chr>   <chr>       <chr>   <chr> <date>     <chr> <dttm>              <chr>  #>  1 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-03-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:08 5bdr4… #>  2 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-04-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:02 kQTSM… #>  3 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-05-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:15 dRPRI… #>  4 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-06-01 15.8… 2024-10-01 14:51:59 GzZd4… #>  5 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-07-01 15.8… 2024-10-01 14:52:10 POYCr… #>  6 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-08-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:01 rsxim… #>  7 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-09-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:14 UH0Q+… #>  8 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-10-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:51:55 0m9EC… #>  9 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-11-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:08 xihTt… #> 10 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-12-01 16.0… 2024-10-01 14:51:53 jbFMg… #> # ℹ 125 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: url <chr> # First release, 2021 March 01 (url <- releases$url[1]) #> [1] "https://storage.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/public-download-files/o/hgnc%2Farchive%2Farchive%2Fmonthly%2Ftsv%2Fhgnc_complete_set_2021-03-01.txt?generation=1727794328124222&alt=media" import_hgnc_dataset(file = url) #> # A tibble: 42,423 × 53 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name     locus_group locus_type status location #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>    <chr>       <chr>      <chr>  <chr>    #>  1 HGNC:5            5 A1BG      alpha-1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  2 HGNC:37133    37133 A1BG-AS1  A1BG an… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  3 HGNC:24086    24086 A1CF      APOBEC1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 10q11.23 #>  4 HGNC:7            7 A2M       alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  5 HGNC:27057    27057 A2M-AS1   A2M ant… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  6 HGNC:23336    23336 A2ML1     alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  7 HGNC:41022    41022 A2ML1-AS1 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  8 HGNC:41523    41523 A2ML1-AS2 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  9 HGNC:8            8 A2MP1     alpha-2… pseudogene  pseudogene Appro… 12p13.31 #> 10 HGNC:30005    30005 A3GALT2   alpha 1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 1p35.1   #> # ℹ 42,413 more rows #> # ℹ 45 more variables: location_sortable <chr>, alias_symbol <list>, #> #   alias_name <list>, prev_symbol <list>, prev_name <list>, gene_family <chr>, #> #   gene_family_id <chr>, date_approved_reserved <date>, #> #   date_symbol_changed <date>, date_name_changed <date>, date_modified <date>, #> #   entrez_id <chr>, ensembl_gene_id <chr>, vega_id <chr>, ucsc_id <chr>, #> #   ena <list>, refseq_accession <list>, ccds_id <list>, uniprot_ids <list>, …

what: Gene symbol to HUGO identifier and back
title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # Example bundled data set. hgnc_dt <- hgnc_dataset_example()  # From gene symbol to HUGO identifier crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1"),   from = "symbol",   to = "hgnc_id",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1] "HGNC:5"     "HGNC:37133"  # and back. crosswalk(   c("HGNC:5", "HGNC:37133"),   from = "hgnc_id",   to = "symbol",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1] "A1BG"     "A1BG-AS1"

title: Crosswalk across identifiers
text: Note typically one--many mapping, result list instead character vector.
code: crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1", "A1CF"),   from = "symbol",   to = "alias_symbol",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [[1]] #> [1] NA #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "FLJ23569" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "ACF"       "ASP"       "ACF64"     "ACF65"     "APOBEC1CF"

title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # From gene symbol to locus group crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1"),   from = "symbol",   to = "locus_group",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1] "protein-coding gene" "non-coding RNA"

title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # From gene symbol to locus type crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1"),   from = "symbol",   to = "locus_type",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1] "gene with protein product" "RNA, long non-coding"

what: Gene symbol to Entrez gene id
title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # From gene symbol to Entrez gene id crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1"),   from = "symbol",   to = "entrez_id",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1]      1 503538

what: Gene symbol to Ensembl gene id
title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # From gene symbol to Ensembl gene id crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1"),   from = "symbol",   to = "ensembl_gene_id",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [1] "ENSG00000121410" "ENSG00000268895"

what: Gene symbol to MGI marker id
title: Crosswalk across identifiers
code: # From gene symbol to MGI marker id crosswalk(   c("A1BG", "A1BG-AS1", "AADACL4"),   from = "symbol",   to = "mgd_id",   hgnc_dataset = hgnc_dt ) #> [[1]] #> [1] "MGI:2152878" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] NA #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "MGI:2685282" "MGI:2685284" "MGI:2685880" "MGI:3650257" "MGI:3650721" #> [6] "MGI:3652194"

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: goal hgnc easily import Human Gene Nomenclature R.

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: Install hgnc CRAN:
code: install.packages("hgnc")

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: import latest HGNC gene data set tabular format directly memory tibble follows:
code: library(hgnc) # Check the date of HGNC last update last_update() #> [1] "2025-06-17 11:10:30 UTC" # Import the data set in tidy tabular format (hgnc_dataset <- import_hgnc_dataset()) #> # A tibble: 44,117 × 55 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name     locus_group locus_type status location #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>    <chr>       <chr>      <chr>  <chr>    #>  1 HGNC:5            5 A1BG      alpha-1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  2 HGNC:37133    37133 A1BG-AS1  A1BG an… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  3 HGNC:24086    24086 A1CF      APOBEC1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 10q11.23 #>  4 HGNC:7            7 A2M       alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  5 HGNC:27057    27057 A2M-AS1   A2M ant… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  6 HGNC:23336    23336 A2ML1     alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  7 HGNC:41022    41022 A2ML1-AS1 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  8 HGNC:41523    41523 A2ML1-AS2 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  9 HGNC:8            8 A2MP1     alpha-2… pseudogene  pseudogene Appro… 12p13.31 #> 10 HGNC:30005    30005 A3GALT2   alpha 1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 1p35.1   #> # ℹ 44,107 more rows #> # ℹ 47 more variables: location_sortable <chr>, alias_symbol <list>, #> #   alias_name <list>, prev_symbol <list>, prev_name <list>, gene_group <list>, #> #   gene_group_id <list>, date_approved_reserved <date>, #> #   date_symbol_changed <date>, date_name_changed <date>, date_modified <date>, #> #   entrez_id <chr>, ensembl_gene_id <chr>, vega_id <chr>, ucsc_id <chr>, #> #   ena <list>, refseq_accession <list>, ccds_id <list>, uniprot_ids <list>, …

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: Use crosswalk() convert values found one columns HGNC gene data set values another:
code: # convert a set of hgnc_ids to symbols hgnc_ids <- c("HGNC:44948", "HGNC:43240", "HGNC:23357", "HGNC:1855", "HGNC:39400") crosswalk(hgnc_ids, from = 'hgnc_id', to = 'symbol') #> [1] "GOLGA2P6"  "RNA5SP340" "MCTS1"     "CENPCP1"   "ASNSP4"  # convert a set of entrez_ids to ensembl_gene_ids entrez_ids <- c(79933, 109623458, 158471, 54987, 81631) crosswalk(entrez_ids, from = 'entrez_id', to = 'ensembl_gene_id') #> [1] "ENSG00000166317" NA                "ENSG00000106772" "ENSG00000162384" #> [5] "ENSG00000140941"

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: go www.genenames.org download files . need R package? hgnc really just convenience package. main advantage function import_hgnc_dataset() reads data tabular format columns appropriate type (don’t specify ). extra step, variables contain multiple values encoded list-columns. Remember list-columns can expanded tidyr::unnest(). E.g., alias_symbol list-column containing multiple alternative aliases standard symbol: addition, also provide function filter_by_keyword() allows filtering data set based keyword regular expression. default function look columns contain gene symbols names (symbol, name, alias_symbol, alias_name, prev_symbol prev_name). works automatically list-columns . Look entries data set contain keyword "TP53": Restrict search symbol column: Search whole word "TP53" exactly taking advantage regular expressions:
code: hgnc_dataset |>   dplyr::filter(symbol == 'TP53') |>   dplyr::select(c('symbol', 'alias_symbol')) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   symbol alias_symbol #>   <chr>  <list>       #> 1 TP53   <chr [2]>  hgnc_dataset |>   dplyr::filter(symbol == 'TP53') |>   dplyr::select(c('symbol', 'alias_symbol')) |>   tidyr::unnest(cols = 'alias_symbol') #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   symbol alias_symbol #>   <chr>  <chr>        #> 1 TP53   p53          #> 2 TP53   LFS1 hgnc_dataset |>   filter_by_keyword('TP53') |>   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 66 × 4 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol      name                                        #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>       <chr>                                       #>  1 HGNC:49685    49685 ABHD15-AS1  ABHD15 antisense RNA 1                      #>  2 HGNC:56226    56226 FAM169A-AS1 FAM169A antisense RNA 1                     #>  3 HGNC:4136      4136 GAMT        guanidinoacetate N-methyltransferase        #>  4 HGNC:54868    54868 KLRK1-AS1   KLRK1 antisense RNA 1                       #>  5 HGNC:6568      6568 LGALS7      galectin 7                                  #>  6 HGNC:28298    28298 LIF-AS2     LIF antisense RNA 2                         #>  7 HGNC:26628    26628 LINC00324   long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 324  #>  8 HGNC:28278    28278 LINC00526   long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 526  #>  9 HGNC:53222    53222 LINC02303   long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 2303 #> 10 HGNC:53545    53545 LINC02525   long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 2525 #> # ℹ 56 more rows hgnc_dataset |>   filter_by_keyword('TP53', cols = 'symbol') |>   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 23 × 4 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name                                            #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>                                           #>  1 HGNC:11998    11998 TP53      tumor protein p53                               #>  2 HGNC:29984    29984 TP53AIP1  tumor protein p53 regulated apoptosis inducing… #>  3 HGNC:11999    11999 TP53BP1   tumor protein p53 binding protein 1             #>  4 HGNC:12000    12000 TP53BP2   tumor protein p53 binding protein 2             #>  5 HGNC:16328    16328 TP53BP2P1 tumor protein p53 binding protein 2 pseudogene… #>  6 HGNC:43652    43652 TP53COR1  tumor protein p53 pathway corepressor 1         #>  7 HGNC:19373    19373 TP53I3    tumor protein p53 inducible protein 3           #>  8 HGNC:16842    16842 TP53I11   tumor protein p53 inducible protein 11          #>  9 HGNC:25102    25102 TP53I13   tumor protein p53 inducible protein 13          #> 10 HGNC:18022    18022 TP53INP1  tumor protein p53 inducible nuclear protein 1   #> # ℹ 13 more rows hgnc_dataset |>   filter_by_keyword('^TP53$', cols = 'symbol') |>   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol name              #>   <chr>         <int> <chr>  <chr>             #> 1 HGNC:11998    11998 TP53   tumor protein p53

title: Import Human Gene Nomenclature
text: cite HGNC nomenclature resources use: Tweedie S, Braschi B, Gray KA, Jones TEM, Seal RL, Yates B, Bruford EA. Genenames.org: HGNC VGNC resources 2021. Nucleic Acids Res. 49, D939–D946 (2021). doi: 10.1093/nar/gkaa980 cite data within database use following format: HGNC Database, HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC), European Molecular Biology Laboratory, European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), Wellcome Genome Campus, Hinxton, Cambridge CB10 1SD, United Kingdom www.genenames.org. Please include month year retrieved data cited.

what: Convert an HGNC value to another — crosswalk
title: Convert an HGNC value to another — crosswalk
text: crosswalk() convert values found one columns HGNC gene data set values another.

title: Convert an HGNC value to another — crosswalk
code: crosswalk(value, from, to = from, hgnc_dataset = import_hgnc_dataset())

title: Convert an HGNC value to another — crosswalk
text: value character vector values matched column. values must match column values, otherwise NA returned. name column HGNC gene data set (hgnc_dataset) values passed value used queries. name column whose values returned, corresponding matches column. hgnc_dataset data frame corresponding HGNC gene data set. Typically, get hold HGNC gene data set import_hgnc_dataset(). testing purposes offline solution, may use alternatively function hgnc_dataset_example() providing subset.

title: Convert an HGNC value to another — crosswalk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Map a gene symbol to its HUGO identifier. crosswalk(value = "A1BG", from = "symbol", to = "hgnc_id")  # If `from` and `to` refer to the same column, `crosswalk()` will filter # out unmatched values by converting them to `NA`. crosswalk(value = c("A1BG", "Not a gene"), from = "symbol", to = "symbol")  # This is the default behavior, so you can simply call: crosswalk(value = c("A1BG", "Not a gene"), from = "symbol") } # }

what: Download the human gene nomenclature dataset — download_hgnc_dataset
title: Download the human gene nomenclature dataset — download_hgnc_dataset
text: download_hgnc_dataset() gets latest HGNC approved data set.

title: Download the human gene nomenclature dataset — download_hgnc_dataset
code: download_hgnc_dataset(   url = latest_archive_url(),   path = getwd(),   filename = basename(url) )

title: Download the human gene nomenclature dataset — download_hgnc_dataset
text: url character string naming URL HGNC dataset. defaults latest available archive. path directory path downloaded file saved. default, value NULL data imported directly memory without saving disk. filename character string name saved file. default, inferred last part URL.

title: Download the human gene nomenclature dataset — download_hgnc_dataset
text: path saved file.

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: Filter HGNC data set keyword (regex) looked columns containing gene names symbols. default, look symbol, name, alias_symbol, alias_name, prev_symbol prev_name. Note function dives list-columns matching returns gene entry least one strings matches keyword.

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
code: filter_by_keyword(   tbl,   keyword,   cols = c("symbol", "name", "alias_symbol", "alias_name", "prev_symbol", "prev_name") )

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: tbl tibble containing HGNC data set, typically obtained import_hgnc_dataset(). keyword keyword regular expression used search criterion. cols Columns looked .

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: tibble HGNC data set filtered observations matching keyword.

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Start by retrieving the HGNC data set hgnc_tbl <- import_hgnc_dataset()  # Search for entries containing "TP53" in the HGNC data set hgnc_tbl |>   filter_by_keyword('TP53') |>   dplyr::select(1:4)  # The same as above but restrict the search to the `symbol` column hgnc_tbl |>   filter_by_keyword('TP53', cols = 'symbol') |>   dplyr::select(1:4)  # Match "TP53" exactly in the `symbol` column hgnc_tbl |>   filter_by_keyword('^TP53$', cols = 'symbol') |>   dplyr::select(1:4)  # `filter_by_keyword()` is vectorised over `keyword` hgnc_tbl |>   filter_by_keyword(c('^TP53$', '^PIK3CA$'), cols = 'symbol') |>   dplyr::select(1:4) } # }

what: hgnc: Import Human Gene Nomenclature — hgnc-package
title: hgnc: Import Human Gene Nomenclature — hgnc-package
text: set routines quickly download import HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) data set mapping gene symbols gene entries genomic databases resources.

title: Example HGNC data set — hgnc_dataset_example
text: hgnc_dataset_example() provides example HGNC data set. example contains first 10,000 gene entries HGNC data set dated 2024-07-26 03:11:20. mostly used example code require internet connection.

title: Example HGNC data set — hgnc_dataset_example
code: hgnc_dataset_example()

title: Example HGNC data set — hgnc_dataset_example
text: tibble whose structure documented import_hgnc_dataset().

title: Example HGNC data set — hgnc_dataset_example
code: hgnc_dataset_example() #> # A tibble: 10,000 × 55 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name     locus_group locus_type status location #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>    <chr>       <chr>      <chr>  <chr>    #>  1 HGNC:5            5 A1BG      alpha-1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  2 HGNC:37133    37133 A1BG-AS1  A1BG an… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 19q13.43 #>  3 HGNC:24086    24086 A1CF      APOBEC1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 10q11.23 #>  4 HGNC:7            7 A2M       alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  5 HGNC:27057    27057 A2M-AS1   A2M ant… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  6 HGNC:23336    23336 A2ML1     alpha-2… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  7 HGNC:41022    41022 A2ML1-AS1 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  8 HGNC:41523    41523 A2ML1-AS2 A2ML1 a… non-coding… RNA, long… Appro… 12p13.31 #>  9 HGNC:8            8 A2MP1     alpha-2… pseudogene  pseudogene Appro… 12p13.31 #> 10 HGNC:30005    30005 A3GALT2   alpha 1… protein-co… gene with… Appro… 1p35.1   #> # ℹ 9,990 more rows #> # ℹ 47 more variables: location_sortable <chr>, alias_symbol <list>, #> #   alias_name <list>, prev_symbol <list>, prev_name <list>, gene_group <list>, #> #   gene_group_id <list>, date_approved_reserved <date>, #> #   date_symbol_changed <date>, date_name_changed <date>, date_modified <date>, #> #   entrez_id <int>, ensembl_gene_id <chr>, vega_id <chr>, ucsc_id <chr>, #> #   ena <list>, refseq_accession <list>, ccds_id <list>, uniprot_ids <list>, …

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: import_hgnc_dataset() imports HGNC data R. Specify directory path addition wish save data disk.

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
code: import_hgnc_dataset(file = latest_archive_url())

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: file file URL complete HGNC data set (TSV format). Use list_archives() list previous versions data. Pass one URLs (column url) file import specific version. default value file URL corresponding latest version, .e. returned value latest_archive_url().

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: tibble HGNC data set consisting 55 columns: hgnc_id: unique ID provided HGNC gene approved symbol. IDs format 'HGNC:n', n unique number. HGNC IDs remain stable even name symbol changes. hgnc_id2: stripped version hgnc_id prefix 'HGNC:' removed. column added package {hgnc}. symbol: official gene symbol approved HGNC, typically short form gene name. Symbols approved accordance Guidelines Human Gene Nomenclature. name: full gene name approved HGNC; corresponds approved symbol . locus_group: group name set related locus types defined HGNC. One : 'protein-coding gene', 'non-coding RNA', 'pseudogene' ''. locus_type: Specifies genetic class gene entry, including various types RNA gene-related categories, pseudogenes virus integration sites. status: Status symbol report, can either 'Approved' 'Entry Withdrawn'. location: Chromosomal location. Indicates cytogenetic location gene region chromosome, e.g., '19q13.43'. absence information, may listed 'reference assembly', 'unplaced', 'reserved'. location_sortable: sortable version location column, allowing easier sorting chromosomal location. alias_symbol: Alternative symbols used refer gene. Aliases may literature, databases, represent membership gene group. alias_name: Alternative names gene. Aliases may literature, databases, represent membership gene group. prev_symbol: field displays symbols previously HGNC-approved nomenclature. prev_name: field displays names previously HGNC-approved nomenclature. gene_group: gene group. gene assigned one groups, according either sequence similarity information publications, specialist advisors, databases. gene_group_id: Gene group identifier, integer number. column contains gene group identifiers. See gene_group gene group name. date_approved_reserved: date entry first approved. date_symbol_changed: date gene symbol last changed. date_name_changed: date gene name last changed. date_modified: Date entry last modified. entrez_id: Entrez gene identifier. ensembl_gene_id: Ensembl gene identifier. vega_id: VEGA gene identifier. ucsc_id: UCSC gene identifier. ena: International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (GenBank, ENA DDBJ) accession number(s). refseq_accession: Reference Sequence (RefSeq) identifier entry, provided NCBI. ccds_id: Consensus CDS identifier. uniprot_ids: UniProt protein accession. pubmed_id: Pubmed Europe Pubmed Central PMIDs. mgd_id: Mouse genome informatics database identifier. rgd_id: Rat genome database gene identifier. lsdb: name Locus Specific Mutation Database URL gene. cosmic: Symbol used within Catalogue somatic mutations cancer gene. omim_id: Online Mendelian Inheritance Man (OMIM) identifier. mirbase: miRBase identifier. homeodb: Homeobox Database identifier. snornabase: snoRNABase identifier. bioparadigms_slc: Symbol used link SLC tables database bioparadigms.org gene. orphanet: Orphanet identifier. pseudogene_org: Pseudogene.org identifier. horde_id: Symbol used within HORDE gene. merops: Identifier used link MEROPS peptidase database. imgt: Symbol used within international ImMunoGeneTics information system. iuphar: objectId used link IUPHAR/BPS Guide PHARMACOLOGY database. kznf_gene_catalog: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Human KZNF Gene Catalog (LLNL) identifier. mamit_trnadb: Identifier link Mamit-tRNA database. cd: Symbol used within Human Cell Differentiation Molecule database gene. lncrnadb: lncRNA Database identifier. enzyme_id: ENZYME EC accession number. intermediate_filament_db: Identifier used link Human Intermediate Filament Database. rna_central_ids: Identifier RNAcentral, non-coding RNA sequence database. lncipedia: LNCipedia identifier gene belongs. appear gene long non-coding RNA. gtrnadb: GtRNAdb identifier gene belongs. appear gene tRNA. agr: Alliance Genomic Resources HGNC ID Human gene page within resource. mane_select: MANE Select nucleotide accession version (.e., NCBI RefSeq Ensembl transcript ID version). gencc: Gene Curation Coalition (GenCC) Database identifier.

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset

what: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
title: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
text: function lists monthly quarterly archives currently available HGNC's Google Cloud Storage.

title: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
code: list_archives(release = c("monthly", "quarterly"))

title: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
text: release Series type: "monthly" "quarterly".

title: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
text: tibble available archives download following columns: series: whether "monthly" "quarterly". dataset: type data set ("hgnc_complete_set", "symbol-changes-monthly", "withdrawn" "symbol-changes-quarterly"). file: file name. date: update date. size: file size. last_modified: date-time file last modification server. md5sum: MD5 checksum. url: direct address archive.

title: List monthly or quarterly archives — list_archives
code: try(list_archives()) #> # A tibble: 135 × 9 #>    series  dataset     archive file  date       size  last_modified       md5sum #>    <chr>   <chr>       <chr>   <chr> <date>     <chr> <dttm>              <chr>  #>  1 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-03-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:08 5bdr4… #>  2 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-04-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:02 kQTSM… #>  3 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-05-01 15.2… 2024-10-01 14:52:15 dRPRI… #>  4 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-06-01 15.8… 2024-10-01 14:51:59 GzZd4… #>  5 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-07-01 15.8… 2024-10-01 14:52:10 POYCr… #>  6 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-08-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:01 rsxim… #>  7 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-09-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:14 UH0Q+… #>  8 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-10-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:51:55 0m9EC… #>  9 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-11-01 15.9… 2024-10-01 14:52:08 xihTt… #> 10 monthly hgnc_compl… hgnc_c… hgnc… 2021-12-01 16.0… 2024-10-01 14:51:53 jbFMg… #> # ℹ 125 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: url <chr>

what: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
title: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
text: function checks whether specific element vector x appears exactly vector y.

title: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
code: matches_once(x, y)

title: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
text: x vector containing elements match. y vector elements x matched.

title: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
text: logical vector length x, element TRUE matches exactly y, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if an Element Matches Exactly Once — matches_once
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3) y <- c(1, 1, 2, 4) matches_once(x, y) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE

code: n_match(x, y)

title: Count the Number of Matches for Each Element in a Vector — n_match
text: x vector elements matched. y vector elements x matched.

title: Count the Number of Matches for Each Element in a Vector — n_match
text: integer vector length x, element indicates number times matches y.

hgnc 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-29 Fix https://github.com/ramiromagno/hgnc/issues/2.

title: hgnc 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-29 Transition documentation https://maialab.org https://rmagno.eu. Updated ftp_ls() reflect server side changes.

title: hgnc 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-08 Fixed code examples relied Internet resources — examples longer fail resources available. Eliminated dependency memoise altogether https://github.com/r-lib/memoise/issues/76.

title: hgnc 0.1.1
text: filter_by_keyword() now vectorised keyword. import_hgnc_dataset() now memoised.

title: hgnc 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-21 First version hgnc.
